meanings.definition: A sensory receptor that responds to chemical stimuli in the environment.
meanings.sent1: The chemoreceptors in the nose help us smell different scents.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study chemoreceptors to understand how animals detect food.
meanings.sent3: The chemoreceptors in the garden soil were gossiping about the new fertilizer.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition acted like chemoreceptors, sensing the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The chemoreceptors on the tongue can distinguish between sweet and salty tastes.

meanings.definition: Cells that detect changes in chemical concentrations in the body.
meanings.sent1: Chemoreceptors in the brain monitor oxygen levels to regulate breathing.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use chemoreceptors to diagnose certain medical conditions.
meanings.sent3: The chemoreceptors in the stomach were on strike, causing confusion in the digestive system.
meanings.sent4: His chemoreceptors seemed to be in overdrive, picking up on every subtle change in the air.
meanings.sent5: The chemoreceptors in the skin can sense when we come in contact with harmful chemicals.
